intro: Astronia fraterna, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, woolly fruits that contain seeds. Astronia fraterna thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its nocturnal blooming habit makes it a unique and attractive species for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
